data.Sentence_cn: 曾经有一个时期,芝加哥的店主和商行的老板们不得不拿出大笔的钱给歹徒以换取'保护'。
data.Sentence: There was a time when the owners of shops and businesses in Chicago had to pay large sums of money to gangsters in return for 'protection'.

data.Sentence_cn: 如果交款不及时,歹徒们就会很快捣毁他的商店,让他破产。
data.Sentence: If the money was not paid promptly, the gangsters would quickly put a man out of business by destroying his shop.

data.Sentence_cn: 榨取'保护金'并不是一种现代的罪恶行径。
data.Sentence: Obtaining 'protection money' is not a modern crime.

data.Sentence_cn: 早在14世纪,英国人约翰.霍克伍德就有过非凡的发现:
data.Sentence: As long ago as the fourteenth century, an Englishman, Sir John Hawkwood, made the remarkable discovery

data.Sentence_cn: '人们情愿拿出大笔的钱,也不愿毕生的心血毁于歹徒之手。
data.Sentence: that people would rather pay large sums of money than have their life work destroyed by gangsters.

data.Sentence_cn: 600年前,约翰.霍克伍德爵士带着一队士兵来到意大利,在佛罗伦萨附近驻扎下来,
data.Sentence: Six hundred years ago, Sir John Hawkwood arrived in Italy with a band of soldiers and settled near Florence.

data.Sentence_cn: 很快就出了名。意大利人叫他乔凡尼.阿库托。
data.Sentence: He soon made a name for himself and came to be known to the Italians as Giovanni Acuto.

data.Sentence_cn: 每次意大利各城邦之间打伏,
data.Sentence: Whenever the Italian city-states were at war with each other,

data.Sentence_cn: 霍克伍德便把他的士兵雇佣给愿给他出高价的君主。
data.Sentence: Hawkwood used to hire his soldiers to princes who were willing to pay the high price he demanded.

data.Sentence_cn: 和平时期,当生意萧条时,霍克伍德便带领士兵进入某个城邦,
data.Sentence: In times of peace, when business was bad, Hawkwood and his men would march into a city-state and,

data.Sentence_cn: 纵火烧毁一两个农场,然后提出,如向他们缴纳保护金,他们便主动撤离。
data.Sentence: after burning down a few farms, would offer to go away if protection money was paid to them.

data.Sentence_cn: 霍克伍德用这种方法挣了大笔钱。
data.Sentence: Hawkwood made large sums of money in this way.

data.Sentence_cn: 尽管如此,意大利人还是把他视作某种英雄。
data.Sentence: In spite of this, the Italians regarded him as a sort of hero.

data.Sentence_cn: 他80岁那年死去时,佛罗伦萨人为他举行了国葬,
data.Sentence: When he died at the age of eighty, the Florentines gave him a state funeral

data.Sentence_cn: 并为他画像以纪念这位“骁勇无比的战士、杰出的领袖乔凡尼.阿库托先生”。
data.Sentence: and had a picture painted which was dedicated to the memory of 'the most valiant soldier and most notable leader, Signor Giovanni Haukodue'.
